intro: Eremogone americana, commonly known as the American eremogone, is a perennial flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as grasslands and open woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Eremogone americana is often found in the western and central regions of the United States.
